intro: Monoptilon bellioides, commonly known as the bell-shaped daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spiny fruits called achenes. Monoptilon bellioides is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in full sun.
